intro: Amphilophium granulosum, commonly known as the rough-leaved amphilophium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
